WRITING.TITLE: Still the closest I've come to hooking up on tinder...

WRITING.TEXT:
Wow. That was beyond expectation. This is the first time I've tried one of these writing prompts and I couldn't have enjoyed the result more.
Bravo

WRITING.TITLE: [WP] An old man living alone in the woods kills a deer. He uses every part including the teeth to fashion himself a set of dentures which he uses to eat the meat. At night he is plagued by nightmares of becoming the deer and reliving it's life over and over..

WRITING.TEXT: That's who gave him the time travel technology to go back to 1875...
That's what he wants you to think..
Please put a small monkey with tiny cowboy hat on it now please. Thank you.
Canon rebel XTi with T-ring adapter 3x barlow lens Orion XT10 dobsonian reflector

Yeah these were all my first attempts at planets. One thing I will say is that with a dobsonian setup like mine it is much better for visual observations but it is hard to resist to try to capture them. For instance, visually they all showed much better detail with surface features on mars, Jupiter's great red spot was much more defined and Saturn's rings in more detail and also five moons. So dont get too discouraged by these. But if you are looking to mainly take pictures I would go with an SCT or catodiopteric. The problems with the dobsonian are that I need to use a barlow lens which blows your resolution and its not gear drivin so I cant track the movement of the sky so no deep sky photos. Although visually galaxies, comets, and nebulae are all easily achievable. I hope that helps. Happy observing!

WRITING.TITLE: Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, and Uranus all from different pics taken in singke exposures with a dslr through my 10" dobsonion
